PTAL; I've made significant changes to split Window.Bound into a composite in all cases, introducing `Window.Assign` to be the primitive that assigns windows in all cases (within the Java SDK)

This totally fell off my radar. Sorry for letting this sit so long.

From the [JIRA](https://issues.apache.org/jira/browse/BEAM-1160?focusedCommentId=15886223&page=com.atlassian.jira.plugin.system.issuetabpanels:comment-tabpanel#comment-15886223):

> I think we should generalize this into a user-provided function that runs after expanding the glob, but before execution. This would enable handling of inconsistent file systems (like handling @N file pattern), and would solve the empty glob problem by default.

Having a generalized user-provided function makes sense to me. It would have a much larger surface area than the above proposed change and should have some more design thought (what context is available to user fn, how does this type of hook generalize for other IO transforms).

I have had less time for Beam contributions lately. I'd be happy to carry through the proposed change above, but I won't be able to tackle a new design right now. Is there somebody else that could pick this up? @davorbonaci @dhalperi ?

retest this please (current build break caused by maven repo connection issue)

We ran into an issue where my previous changes were causing the IO ITs to *always* be run. So now, I've set up a profile so they will only be run when that profile is specified.

I've tested this locally with the same maven command that jenkins runs, so it should no longer run the IO ITs inappropriately.

Thanks Davor, The extra optimizations are the following:

Maven args:
```
--threads 1C            Executes 1 thread per core (Enables parallelism).
```
JVM arguments:
```
-XX:+TieredCompilation  Enables Tiered Compilation. This improves startup time.
-XX:TieredStopAtLevel=1 Uses full optimization (no profiling) to make the run faster.
```
Finally some references on speeding Maven and Tiered compilation.
Refs.
https://zeroturnaround.com/rebellabs/your-maven-build-is-slow-speed-it-up/
http://blog2.vorburger.ch/2016/06/improve-maven-build-speed-with-q.html
https://www.slideshare.net/maddocig/tiered
https://docs.oracle.com/javase/7/docs/technotes/guides/vm/performance-enhancements-7.html
Any comment on the diff, say old runtime vs. new runtime?
